reviewText:
This Visual Novel taking place in the year 2050, 150 years before the events of the BlazBlue series
You As Touya Kagari is a resident of Shin Yokozaki City and a sophomore at the prestigious Hakuō North Academy and of course you're Innocent People Who Doesn't know anything and you're the one who survive after Wadatsumi Mass Vanish Incident.

after that you will meet a girl, girl and more girl.. of course choose what's your favorite waifu?

Here's A Little Review About This VN
- The Character Looks Great and beautiful unless Sechs, Who's that guy? looks like BOYBAND
- The Main Story has a rhythm up and down of course, sometimes tense and sometimes happy like another VN
- The Soundtracks Are Cool, But I prefer a DUBSTEP
- Toi Sometimes Called Technology of Interest, is an application in XBlaze – Code: Embryo that can be used to alter the course and outcome of the story depending on what articles are read or left unread.
There's A 3 Toi such as ToI Avaiable To Read, ToI Locked (You Cant Access), and ToI Event. by pressing  J Button

Originally posted by author: Be Sure To Read Toi and Sometimes You Will See CG Art, good luck for finding them,

reviewText:
XBlaze Code: Embryo is a game set 150 years before the events of Blazblue Calamity Trigger, serving to explain some of the lore behind the game, Don't worry if you have not played the main series, this game does a good enough job of explaining most of the things. I think one of the great things about how they went about doing it is that lore is first introduced then explained (such as Izayoi and its curse). This gives some satisfaction to those who are fans of the series as well as not alienating the new comers.

I have been a great fan of the game, ever since I saw a preview of the first game, Blazblue: Calamity Trigger, in a magazine. This game was great in helping me answer some questions (the origins of Takamagahara) as well as providing me with more questions for this already confusing lore.

The art is not that amazing. It looks abit pixlated and stretched on my monitor. However, the music featured was nice, some of the tracks even paying hommage to the blazblue tracks. Moreover, the game play was interesting. As a visual novel, the game allows you to make desicions" through reading articles. The type and amount of articles you read affect the decisions made by the characters
recommended: the type of ending that you would get. Lastly
hoursPlayed: the story was actually quite cliche. If you are a long time anime viewer
voteText: the plot would not surprise you one bit. Before events happened
helpfulPercent: I had already kinda predicted what was about to occur.\n\nThe major turn off of this game for me was the main character.  Did you watch the anime Gulity Crown? The MC is almost exactly like Shu
votesHelpful: Season 1 Shu. He is seriously irritating. He is the kind of character which I know would die first if he was not MC.\n\nAll in all
votesTotal: I had a great time playing this game. I recommend this game to any Blazblue fan out there."

reviewText:
This game doesn't have Steam Trading Cards.
I bought it, looked at the Option Menu for like 6 minutes to have the right write a review, and exited so that I could write this line:
PLEASE add Steam Trading Cards
and to support the developers (I didn't like it when I saw a guy talking about playing this VN, but a pirated version, on Facebook), but still mostly to write this line (twice)
PLEASE add Steam Trading Cards

Will definitely delete and write a proper review after I can play it. For now, it will idle in my Library due to having no Cards.

reviewText: The only thing i don't like about this game would have to be that there is no english voice's in the game other than that it's a great game. (also sadly there is no option to set the res to 1600 by 900 unless im blind)

Product received for free

The Good:  Interesting story (kind of required for a visual novel) and multiple paths give lots of replay.

The Bad:  It is very easy to miss reading an article on the TOi, which can ruin your current run.  Make sure to have multiple saves!

The SaHD:  Admittedly not much of the plot was a surprise to me, since I reviewed the sequel to this before playing this game.  I also found I prefer visual novels on a portable device to the PC.

See more reviews at my site, sahdgamer.com!
